summary: This is a sealed federal indictment from the Southern District of New York charging Jeffrey Epstein with one count of sex trafficking conspiracy and one count of sex trafficking. It alleges that from at least 2002 to 2005, Epstein sexually exploited dozens of minor girls at his residences in Manhattan and Palm Beach, using a network of employees and victim-recruiters to facilitate the abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant charged with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors. The indictment alleges he sexually exploited dozens of minor girls at his homes in New York and Florida, paying them cash and using a network of employees and victim-recruiters.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney who signed and filed the indictment on behalf of the United States government.

events.title: Sex Trafficking Conspiracy Period
events.description: The period during which Jeffrey Epstein is alleged to have conspired to and engaged in the sex trafficking of minors at his residences in New York and Florida.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-1 and Scheduling Call
events.description: Epstein enticed and recruited Minor Victim-1, who was repeatedly abused at the New York Residence. Employee-1, on behalf of Epstein, placed a phone call to Minor Victim-1 to schedule an appointment for paid sex acts.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-2
events.description: Minor Victim-2 was recruited and repeatedly sexually abused by Epstein at the Palm Beach Residence over a period of years.

events.title: Scheduling Calls for Minor Victims 2 and 3
events.description: Employee-2, on behalf of Epstein, placed phone calls to Minor Victim-2 and Minor Victim-3 in Florida to schedule appointments for paid sex acts at the Palm Beach Residence.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-3
events.description: Minor Victim-3 was recruited and repeatedly sexually abused by Epstein at the Palm Beach Residence. Epstein asked her age and she answered truthfully.

locations: Manhattan, New York (specifically the Upper East Side, New York Residence)
9 East 71st Street, New York, New York (property listed for forfeiture, owned by Maple, Inc.)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction of the court)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is charged with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors, specifically for exploiting dozens of girls as young as 14 from at least 2002 to 2005.
The indictment describes a systematic operation where victims were recruited for 'massages' that escalated into sexual acts, for which they were paid hundreds of dollars in cash.
Epstein allegedly maintained his supply of victims by paying certain victims to recruit other minor girls, creating a 'vast network' of underage victims in New York and Florida.
The indictment references several unnamed employees and associates (Employee-1, Employee-2, Employee-3) who facilitated the scheme by contacting victims and scheduling encounters.
The government seeks forfeiture of specific property, including Epstein's mansion at 9 East 71st Street in New York, owned by Maple, Inc., as property used to facilitate the crimes.
